name: attributively
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
before a noun: Sometimes a proper noun is used attributively, as is "Paris" in "a Paris street". The adjective "warm" is used attributively in the phrase "a warm day". See
attributive
More examplesFewer examplesA noun used attributively modifies another noun.The adjective “well known” is written as “well-known” - with a hyphen - when it is used attributively. Write three sentences using the noun "school" attributively.
